ground_truth: He looks at himself in a mirror. Ferris's hair has light-brown highlights. In an office on a construction site, he speaks to a bald agent posing as a construction worker. Sadiki walks in. As Sadiki and Al-Masri shake hands, Tony takes photographs from a car. Ferris takes the room key from the clerk. He heads upstairs and along a corridor. Ferris lets himself into a hotel room. He walks through the room and out onto the balcony. He climbs over the wall, steps along a ledge, and climbs onto the balcony of the next room. He peers in through the French windows, pushing a long curtain aside. Ferris heads to a laptop on the dressing table. He pushes a device into the socket at the back of the computer. He opens it up. He switches it on and presses some keys. A photo of Sadiki with his family appears on the screen. Ferris dials his cell phone. Garland's at a computer. A number of files appear on the laptop in front of Ferris. In the hotel lobby, Sadiki walks up to the desk and gets his room key. Sadiki walks upstairs to his room. Hearing the door, Ferris quickly shuts the laptop and turns off the desk light. He runs out of the French windows and climbs across to the next balcony. Sadiki walks into the room and gets some money from a bag. He pockets the money. He adjusts the chair in front of the dressing table. He notices the French windows are open and goes to have a look. He pulls back the curtain and slides the window shut. Hoffman is at a kids' soccer match. His daughter prepares to throw in. He takes a photo. On his hands-free mobile. A jet touches down on a runway. Queen Alia International Airport, Amman. Marwan meets Ferris on a corridor. Marwan takes Ferris to an office, where Hani sits reading a newspaper. Ferris sits. Hani puts aside his paper. Ferris meets Skip. Ferris gets in the back of an SUV. At the health clinic, Aisha takes Ferris's blood pressure. She removes the cuff. They smile. Ferris goes up to the counter of a cafe and chooses a pastry. The man behind the counter puts pastries in a box. Ferris drives an SUV through town and parks by an apartment block. Carrying the box of pastries, he walks upstairs to an apartment. He wears brown trousers and a white shirt. Aisha opens the door, smiling. Ferris shuts the door and follows Aisha. Yousef and Rowley watch football on TV. Ferris sits by the boys. Cala puts bowls on the table. Ferris leans closer to the boys. They nod. Ferris smiles at Aisha, who's by the table.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He gazes intently at his own reflection in a mirror, scrutinizing his appearance. Ferris's hair is accentuated with subtle light-brown highlights that catch the light. In an office situated on a bustling construction site, he engages in conversation with a bald agent who is cleverly disguised as a construction worker. At that moment, Sadiki enters the scene. As Sadiki and Al-Masri exchange a firm handshake, Tony discreetly captures photographs from the vantage point of a car. Ferris retrieves the room key from the clerk at the front desk. He makes his way upstairs and proceeds along a corridor. Ferris unlocks the door and enters a hotel room. He moves through the room and steps out onto the balcony. With agility, he climbs over the wall, carefully steps along a narrow ledge, and ascends onto the balcony of the adjacent room. He peers inside through the French windows, gently pushing aside a long curtain. Ferris approaches a laptop positioned on the dressing table. He inserts a device into the socket located at the back of the computer. He opens the laptop, powers it on, and presses several keys. A photograph of Sadiki with his family materializes on the screen. Ferris dials a number on his cell phone. Meanwhile, Garland is seated at a computer. A series of files appear on the laptop screen in front of Ferris. Down in the hotel lobby, Sadiki approaches the desk and retrieves his room key. Sadiki then ascends the stairs to his room. Upon hearing the door, Ferris swiftly closes the laptop and turns off the desk light. He quickly exits through the French windows and climbs back across to the neighboring balcony. Sadiki enters the room and retrieves some money from a bag. He places the money in his pocket. He adjusts the chair positioned in front of the dressing table. Noticing that the French windows are open, he goes over to investigate. He pulls back the curtain and slides the window shut. Meanwhile, Hoffman is attending a kids' soccer match. His daughter is preparing to throw the ball in. He takes a photo while speaking on his hands-free mobile. A jet lands smoothly on a runway at Queen Alia International Airport in Amman. Marwan meets Ferris in a corridor. Marwan escorts Ferris to an office, where Hani is seated, engrossed in reading a newspaper. Ferris takes a seat. Hani sets aside his newspaper. Ferris is introduced to Skip. Ferris climbs into the back of an SUV. At the health clinic, Aisha measures Ferris's blood pressure. She removes the cuff, and they exchange smiles. Ferris approaches the counter of a cafe and selects a pastry. The man behind the counter places the pastries into a box. Ferris drives an SUV through the town and parks near an apartment block. Carrying the box of pastries, he walks upstairs to an apartment. He is dressed in brown trousers and a crisp white shirt. Aisha opens the door, greeting him with a warm smile. Ferris closes the door behind him and follows Aisha inside. Yousef and Rowley are watching football on TV. Ferris takes a seat beside the boys. Cala places bowls on the table. Ferris leans in closer to the boys, who nod in response. Ferris exchanges a smile with Aisha, who is standing by the table.

Meanwhile, Garland is seated comfortably at a computer. A multitude of files appear on the laptop screen that is in front of Ferris. Down in the hotel lobby, Sadiki approaches the desk and retrieves his own room key. He then ascends the stairs leading to his room. Upon hearing the door, Ferris swiftly closes the laptop and turns off the desk light, quickly exiting through the French windows and skillfully climbing back across to the neighboring balcony. Sadiki enters the room and retrieves some money from a bag, carefully placing the money into his pocket. He then adjusts the chair that is positioned in front of the dressing table. Noticing that the French windows are ajar, he goes over to investigate, pulling back the curtain and sliding the window shut securely. Meanwhile, at a kids' soccer match, Hoffman is attentively watching as his daughter prepares to throw the ball in. He takes a photo while simultaneously speaking on his hands-free mobile. Meanwhile, a jet lands smoothly and efficiently on a runway at Queen Alia International Airport in Amman. In the corridor, Marwan meets Ferris and escorts him to an office where Hani is seated, deeply engrossed in reading a newspaper. Ferris takes a seat as Hani sets aside his newspaper, and Ferris is introduced to Skip. Ferris then climbs into the back of an SUV. Later, at a health clinic, Aisha measures Ferris's blood pressure with expertise and care. She gently removes the cuff, and they exchange warm, friendly smiles. Ferris approaches the counter of a local cafe and selects a pastry with care. The man behind the counter obligingly places the pastries into a box. Ferris drives his SUV through the town and deftly parks near an apartment block. Carrying the box of pastries, he walks upstairs to an apartment, dressed in smart brown trousers and a crisp white shirt. Aisha opens the door, greeting him with a warm and inviting smile. Ferris closes the door behind him and follows Aisha inside, where Yousef and Rowley are intently watching football on TV. Ferris takes a seat beside the boys, and Cala places bowls on the table. Ferris leans in closer to the boys, who nod in response to his presence. He exchanges a smile with Aisha, who is standing by the table, adding to the scene's warm atmosphere.

Ferris exchanges a smile with Aisha, who stands by the table.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He looks at himself in a mirror, reflecting on the changes since his last mission abroad. Ferris's hair has light-brown highlights, a detail that helps him blend into different environments. In an office on a construction site, which is bustling with workers and machinery noise, he speaks to a bald agent posing as a construction worker, a common tactic in intelligence operations to gather information unnoticed. Sadiki walks in, his presence adding tension to the room. As Sadiki and Al-Masri, a known local businessman with connections to various groups, shake hands, Tony discreetly takes photographs from a car equipped with surveillance gear. Ferris takes the room key from the clerk, who gives a polite nod, accustomed to regular guests due to the hotel’s proximity to the business district. He heads upstairs and along a corridor with patterned carpets that mute the sound of footsteps. Ferris lets himself into a hotel room that provides a strategic view of the city square below. He walks through the room and out onto the balcony. He climbs over the wall, steps along a ledge, and climbs onto the balcony of the next room, a risky maneuver that requires agility and confidence. He peers in through the French windows, pushing a long curtain aside that slightly sways in the evening breeze. Ferris heads to a laptop on the dressing table, an essential tool for his covert operation. He pushes a device into the socket at the back of the computer, a data transfer tool used for quickly downloading sensitive information. He opens it up. He switches it on and presses some keys. A photo of Sadiki with his family, taken during a recent vacation in Morocco, appears on the screen. Ferris dials his cell phone, an encrypted line to ensure secure communication. Garland's at a computer, remotely assisting Ferris with data decryption. A number of files appear on the laptop in front of Ferris. In the hotel lobby, a grand space with marble floors, Sadiki walks up to the desk and gets his room key. Sadiki walks upstairs to his room. Hearing the door, Ferris quickly shuts the laptop and turns off the desk light. He runs out of the French windows and climbs across to the next balcony, his heart pounding. Sadiki walks into the room and gets some money from a bag, likely for an upcoming transaction. He pockets the money. He adjusts the chair in front of the dressing table. He notices the French windows are open and goes to have a look. He pulls back the curtain and slides the window shut, unaware of the recent presence. Hoffman is at a kids' soccer match, a community event at the local park. His daughter prepares to throw in during a crucial play. He takes a photo with pride on his hands-free mobile. A jet touches down on a runway at Queen Alia International Airport, Amman, a major hub for international travel in the Middle East. Marwan meets Ferris on a corridor, the air filled with the scent of freshly brewed coffee from a nearby stand. Marwan takes Ferris to an office, where Hani sits reading a newspaper, the headlines reflecting current geopolitical tensions. Ferris sits. Hani puts aside his paper, ready to discuss their next move. Ferris meets Skip, an ally with expertise in electronic surveillance. Ferris gets in the back of an SUV, the vehicle subtly armored for protection. At the health clinic, Aisha takes Ferris's blood pressure, a routine check to ensure his well-being. She removes the cuff. They smile, sharing a moment of normalcy amidst their chaotic lives. Ferris goes up to the counter of a cafe known for its artisan pastries and chooses a pastry. The man behind the counter, a friendly local with stories about every visitor, puts pastries in a box. Ferris drives an SUV through town and parks by an apartment block, a modest building with a view of the bustling market street. Carrying the box of pastries, he walks upstairs to an apartment. He wears brown trousers and a white shirt, blending in with the residents. Aisha opens the door, smiling, welcoming him into the warmth of their home. Ferris shuts the door and follows Aisha into the living room. Yousef and Rowley watch football on TV, their favorite way to unwind. Ferris sits by the boys. Cala puts bowls on the table, each filled with a different snack. Ferris leans closer to the boys, asking about the game’s score. They nod, excitedly discussing the match. Ferris smiles at Aisha, who's by the table, grateful for the moment of peace.

High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Hoffman is at a kids' soccer match. His daughter prepares to throw in. He takes a photo. On his handsfree mobile. A jet touches down on a runway. Queen Alia International Airport Amman. Marwan meets Ferris on a corridor. Marwan takes Ferris to an office where Hani sits reading a newspaper. Ferris sits. Hani puts aside his paper. Ferris meets Skip. Ferris gets in the back of an SUV. At the health clinic Aisha takes Ferris's blood pressure. She removes the cuff. They smile. Ferris goes up to the counter of a cafe and chooses a pastry. The man behind the counter puts pastries in a box. Ferris drives an SUV through town and parks by an apartment block. Carrying the box of pastries he walks upstairs to an apartment. He wears brown trousers and a white shirt. Aisha opens the door smiling. Ferris shuts the door and follows Aisha. Yousef and Rowley watch football on TV. Ferris sits by the boys. Cala puts bowls on the table. Ferris leans closer to the boys. They nod. Ferris smiles at Aisha who is by the table.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He looks at himself in a mirror. Ferris's hair has lightbrown highlights. In an office on a construction site he speaks to a bald agent posing as a construction worker. Sadiki walks in. As Sadiki and AlMasri shake hands Tony takes photographs from a car. Ferris takes the room key from the clerk. He heads upstairs and along a corridor. Ferris let us himself into a hotel room. He walks through the room and out onto the balcony. He climbs over the wall steps along a ledge and climbs onto the balcony of the next room. He peers in through the French windows pushing a long curtain aside. Ferris heads to a laptop on the dressing table. He pushes a device into the socket at the back of the computer. He opens it up. He switches it on and presses some keys. A photo of Sadiki with his family appears on the screen. Ferris dials his cell phone. Garland's at a computer. A number of files appear on the laptop in front of Ferris. In the hotel lobby Sadiki walks up to the desk and gets his room key. Sadiki walks upstairs to his room. Hearing the door Ferris quickly shuts the laptop and turns off the desk light. He runs out of the French windows and climbs across to the next balcony. Sadiki walks into the room and gets some money from a bag. He pockets the money. He adjusts the chair in front of the dressing table. He notices the French windows are open and goes to have a look. He pulls back the curtain and slides the window shut. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat stares at a painting in a gallery. Luna's tail has bright-red streaks. In a hut on a mountain trail, the cat chats with a tall baker impersonating a mountain climber. Zara dances in. As Zara and Azim high-five, Max sketches cartoons from a bus. Luna takes the broomstick from the rider. The cat heads downstairs and through a tunnel. Luna slips into a library. The cat crawls through the stacks and onto a veranda. The cat leaps over the fence, tiptoes along a beam, and swings onto the veranda of the adjacent cabin. The cat gazes in through the stained-glass windows, shifting a heavy blanket aside. Luna approaches a typewriter on the vanity. The cat shoves a gadget into the port at the bottom of the gadget. The cat flips it open. The cat boots it up and taps some buttons. A drawing of Zara with her friends appears on the monitor. Luna punches her wristwatch. Kelvin's at a tablet. A series of sketches pop up on the gadget in front of Luna. In the museum atrium, Zara skips up to the kiosk and grabs her broomstick. Zara skips downstairs to her studio. Sensing the creak, Luna swiftly closes the gadget and extinguishes the lamp. The cat bolts out of the stained-glass windows and swings across to the adjacent veranda. Zara skips into the studio and retrieves some marbles from a jar. She pockets the marbles. She pushes the sofa in front of the vanity. She observes the stained-glass windows are ajar and strolls over to peek. She lifts the blanket and slides the window closed. Walters is at a children's kite festival. His niece prepares to launch. He captures an image. On his wireless headset. A blimp lands on a beach. Galactic Port, Mars. Tariq greets Luna in a tunnel. Tariq leads Luna to a studio, where Wafa lounges perusing a comic book. Luna relaxes. Wafa sets down her book. Luna encounters Nate. Luna hops into the back of a truck. At the animal sanctuary, Leila tests Luna's eyesight. She loosens the blindfold. They laugh. Luna approaches the kiosk of a theater and selects a ticket. The girl behind the counter puts tickets in an envelope. Luna rides a bike through the village and halts by a cottage grove. Lugging the envelope of tickets, the cat trots downstairs to a den. The cat wears striped shorts and a black vest. Leila opens the gate, laughing. Luna bolts the gate and ambles after Leila. Jamal and Tommy play chess on a tablet. Luna perches beside the cats. Nadia sets glasses on the shelf. Luna leans nearer to the cats. They purr. Luna grins at Leila, who’s by the shelf.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Ferris examines his reflection in a mirror, noting his light-brown highlights. At a construction site office, he talks to a bald agent masquerading as a worker. Sadiki arrives, shaking hands with Al-Masri while Tony snaps photos from a car. Ferris collects a room key, enters his hotel room, and moves to a neighboring balcony to access a laptop. He plugs a device into it, revealing a photo of Sadiki's family. Ferris contacts Garland, aligning their intel, before Sadiki retrieves his key and heads to his room. Ferris quickly exits the room as Sadiki notices the open French windows. Meanwhile, Hoffman is at a soccer match, while Ferris meets Marwan, who introduces him to Hani. Ferris then visits a health clinic where Aisha checks his blood pressure. They share a smile. Ferris buys pastries, drives through town, and arrives at an apartment. Aisha greets him warmly, and Ferris joins Yousef and Rowley, who are watching football on TV. He exchanges smiles with Aisha, as Cala sets the table.
